The inquest into Wales' awful performance against Scotland is continuing today, with many bemused by how much the side seems to have gone backwards over the past year.
Replacing Warren Gatland was a… [+3536 chars]

articles.author: By Spencer Morgan For Mailonline
articles.title: 'Football cannot be an exception': Pep Guardiola believes Premier League should be brought to a halt - Daily Mail
articles.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola is not convinced that the Premier League should be continuing after the UK enters its second lockdown on Thursday.
articles.content:
Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has suggested that the Premier League should not play on when the UK enters its second lockdown on Thursday.
Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced the restriction… [+2106 chars]

articles.author: By Daniel Davis For Mailonline
articles.title: Mason Mount declares 'world class' Chelsea team-mate Hakim Ziyech a 'joy to play with' - Daily Mail
articles.description: The 27-year-old, who joined from Ajax in the summer for £37million, was forced to wait to make an impact due to a knee injury but has impressed recently with two goals and an assist.
articles.content:
Chelsea star Mason Mount has hailed team-mate Hakim Ziyech as 'world class' after the playmaker spectacularly burst into form last week.
The 27-year-old, who joined from Ajax in the summer for £38mi… [+2133 chars]

articles.author: By Sir Clive Woodward for the Daily Mail
articles.title: SIR CLIVE WOODWARD: Well done, Eddie… but now's the time to abandon this sterile style - Daily Mail
articles.description: SIR CLIVE WOODWARD: Winning the Championship after such a setback in the World Cup final is a major achievement, as is finishing the job without the benefit of a warm-up game.
articles.content:
I am writing this the morning after England won the Six Nations title and huge congratulations to Eddie Jones and the team.
Winning the Championship after such a disappointment in the World Cup fina… [+4114 chars]

articles.author: By Mark Clattenburg For Mailonline
articles.title: MARK CLATTENBURG: Right decisions were made on Harry Kane penalty and Tariq Lamptey equaliser - Daily Mail
articles.description: MARK CLATTENBURG: Harry Kane knew where Adam Lallana was - he looked at him twice as the ball was hanging in the air - and he won the penalty. Tariq Lamptey's goal was right to stand too.
articles.content:
